_header: I pray you M to me be true
Subjects: love letters; lovers, absence/separation of; lovers, addresses to beloved
_description: Humfrey Newton, A love letter to his mistress ‘M’ — one quatrain and eleven couplets

BodLatMisC66.First Lines:
I pray you M to me be trufor I will be tru as longe as I
                    lif…
BodLatMisC66.Last Lines:
…and sithen as we may not to geþer spekebe writynge we
                    shall oure hertes breke
BodLatMisC66.Editions:

Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 492.
